results.title: Klute
results.creator_credit: Alan Pakula and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Her name is Bree Daniels. She’s a tough, high-priced call girl picking her way through the tangled lives that touch hers in the dark maze of New York. Bree once crossed paths with a vicious psychotic killer, who is now stalking her. The only person that can save her is Detective John Klute. Stars Jane Fonda and Donald Sutherland. Excellent adult thriller with attention to detail and emphasis on character.

results.title: The Moon in the Gutter = la Lune Dans le Caniveau
results.creator_credit: Jean-Jacques Beineix, Lise Fayolle, TF1 Films productions and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Gerard Depardieu plays a dock-worker seeking the rapist responsible for his sister’s death. He becomes involved with a wealthy woman (Nastassia Kinski) who assists him in his search. “The moon in the gutter” is notable for its visual beauty and its stunning camera work and editing. By the director of “Diva” and “Betty Blue” and based on a book by David Goodis.

results.title: Ryan's daughter
results.creator_credit: David Lean, Anthony Havelock-Allan and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Robert Mitchum is the rural school master Charles Shaughnessy who, returning home to Ireland in 1916, just after the Easter Rising against the British, falls in love with and marries one of his old pupils, Rosy Ryan. Their happiness is upset by the arrival of a Major who comes to take command of the British Army and is immediately drawn towards Rosy. Political events finally overtake all affairs of the heart, and it is obvious that life in the village of Kirrary will never be the same again. Scripted by Robert Bolt the film also stars Sarah Miles, John Mills, Trevor Howard and Leo McKern.

results.title: La Marseillaise
results.creator_credit: Jean Renoir, Andre Seigneur and La Compagnie Jean Renoir
results.brief_description: Renoir financed “La Marseillaise” entirely from public subscription. The film traces the fortunes of two young men during the French Revolution. Renoir’s characteristic warmth and faith in human nature is prominent, and he concentrates on portraying the lives of ordinary people during the revolutionary period. This is one of the few great films to deal seriously with this momentous time in history.

results.title: The Magnificent Ambersons
results.creator_credit: Orson Welles and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: The Magnificent Ambersons captures the decline and disintegration of an aristocratic family early in the 20th Century. Within a few minutes the situation is established concisely as we see the large Amberson mansion set in spacious grounds and learn that Isabel Amberson did not marry Eugene Morgan, the man she really loved, but Wilbur Minafer, who was socially acceptable. Much of the story revolves around Isabel’s son George Amberson Minafer, who does much to destroy his family. Based on the novel by Booth Tarkington.

results.title: Blithe spirit
results.creator_credit: David Lean, Anthony Havelock-Allan, Cineguild and Two Cities Films
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Noel Coward. Charles, a celebrated novelist and his second wife, Ruth, invite a medium to dinner to aid Charles in writing a thriller about mediums. At the seance, unseen by others present, Charles’ first wife, Elvira, appears and although the medium and Ruth attempt to send Elvira back, she has devised a scheme to keep Charles with her forever. Stars Rex Harrison, Kay Hammond, Constance Cummings and Margaret Rutherford.

results.title: Les Liaisons Dangereuses
results.creator_credit: Roger Vadim, Leopold Schlossberg, Astor Productions and Films Marceau
results.brief_description: Roger Vadim up-dates Choderlos de Laclos’ 18th century novel to present day France. Valmont (Gerard Philipe) and Juliette (Jeanne Moreau) turn love and sex into a game, and in doing so make victims of those who fall for their seductive manipulations. However in their attempt to corrupt the innocent Marianne, love threatens to destroy all the players of the game. The cast also includes Jean-Louis Trintignant. The jazz score is by Thelonious Monk and the excellent photography is by Marcel Grignon.

results.title: On the Town
results.creator_credit: Stanley Donen, Gene Kelly, Arthur Freed, United Artists Corporation and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A great musical comedy which is given full treatment with fine singing and dancing. It is the story of three sailors and their girls. Starring Gene Kelly, Ann Miller and Frank Sinatra.

results.title: Kiss me Kate
results.creator_credit: George Sidney, Jack Cummings and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Kiss me Kate, one of the most celebrated musicals, with its sparkling songs and dazzling wit, stars Kathryn Grayson and Howard Keel at their best, in the battle of the sexes. Kathryn is Lilli Vanessi, the temperamental stage star, Howard is her ex-husband Fred Graham. The action takes place on an opening night with a romantic free-for-all in the dressing rooms and on stage. Unforgettable songs in Cole Porter’s vibrant score and dancing by Ann Miller. Based on the play by Samuel and Bella Spewack.

results.title: High noon
results.creator_credit: Fred Zimmerman, Stanley Kramer and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: A retired marshal is forced to take up his badge and guns again when a killer he has sent to jail returns to town, looking for revenge. The townspeople refuse to help and his new bride wants him to run away from the fight. The marshal meets the killer and his three accomplices at high noon in one of the most suspenseful and thrilling gunfights ever filmed. Starring Gary Cooper and Grace Kelly. Based on the story, “The Tin star”, by John W. Cunningham.
